content:
Welcome! I’m Daniel Zeymer von Metnitz, nearing the completion of my medical studies with a passion that intersects medical image analysis, biostatistics, and health policy advocacy.
At the Ueffing Lab within the University of Tübingen, my research delves into the intricacies of retinal image analysis, contributing to the field with my doctoral work.
My academic journey is complemented by a dedication to teaching, where I serve as an assistant for several courses in biostatistics, sharing my knowledge and fostering learning among my peers. I am active as an IFMSA trainer empowering others in the realms of biostatistics and medical academia.
My clinical experience span prestigious institutions, including the University Hospital Zurich, Charité Berlin, and the University Medical Center Hamburg-Eppendorf, providing me with a robust foundation in medicine. Insights into my professional journey can be found in my CV.
Advocacy is another realm where I’ve dedicated my efforts. As the Vice-President for External Affairs of the IFMSA - International Federation of Medical Students’ Associations, I am deeply committed to advocating on behalf of over 1.5 million medical students worldwide, positioning myself at the epicenter of global student-led health advocacy. I actively contribute to the transformation of healthcare by influencing policy and focus on pivotal health issues such as UHC, digital health, and the Sustainable Development Goals.
My advocacy extends to the Austrian Medical Students’ Union and the Austrian Students’ Union (ÖH), amongst others. Detailed information about my advocacy work is available here.
When I find the time, I channel my creativity into web developement and maintain a disciplined routine as a passionate runner.
To learn more about my professional experiences or to reach out for any inquiries, please view my CV or contact me.
summary: Welcome! I’m Daniel Zeymer von Metnitz, nearing the completion of my medical studies with a passion that intersects medical image analysis, biostatistics, and health policy advocacy.
title: About

content:
My involvement in youth-led organizations and high-level political assemblies over recent years has been driven by a commitment to youth engagement, global health, and climate change advocacy with a focus on digital health, UHC and the Sustainable Development Goals. Here is a summary of my advocacy activities and significant projects:

content:
I welcome your messages and look forward to engaging in meaningful conversations.
For professional networking, feel free to connect on LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/dzvm (link opens in a new tab). For inquiries related to my role within the IFMSA, please email me at my official address: vpe@ifmsa.org. For all other correspondence, including speaking engagements, research collaborations, or general questions, I am available via email.
summary: I welcome your messages and look forward to engaging in meaningful conversations.
title: Contact

content:
Summary #I am Daniel Zeymer von Metnitz, a final-year medical student with a rich background in clinical practice across various medical departments, with a keen focus on vascular medicine. My research centers on medical image analysis, and I am actively engaged in teaching statistics. My advocacy efforts are dedicated to enhancing youth participation in global health dialogues. Below are my most significant positions and experiences.

title: CV

content:
My research interests focus on medical image analysis, vascular diseases, diabetes and disease prediction. My doctoral thesis is under supervision of Prof. Marius Ueffing and J. Dietter. As I am involved within different Student organisations I am also active in Public Health Research and advocacy.
Publications # Blom, Iris Martine, L Campos, MEAY Ali, MMAZ Asyura, D Zeymer von Metnitz, B Limann, E Janušonytė. (2021) ‘Youth versus pandemics: the role of future generations in the pandemic treaty’, THE LANCET Global Health, Link For a detailed list of publications see my Google Scholar, ORCID or ResearchGate profile. Master’s thesis #“Impact of Hypothermia Treatment on One-Year Outcomes in Patients with Cardiogenic Shock and Cardiac Arrest: A CULPRIT-SHOCK Sub-Analysis” under the supversion of Univ.-Prof. Dr. med. Holger Thiele Currently WIP Talks & Posters # Oral Presentation on the topic of “Quantitative analysis of the retinal vascular structure” at the Young Researcher Vision Camp 07/2019 | Castle Wildenstein in Leibertingen, Germany Poster “Automatic Analysis of Retinal Fundus Images” at Ueffing Lab Retreat 2018 | University of Tübingen, Germany Congresses & Workshops #I have been participant to following congresses and workshops:
Management of Aortic Dissections (MADE) Symposium Departement of Vascular Surgery, USZ Zurich, Switzerland 09/2021 | Meeting Participation | Online The Austrian Society of Vascular Surgery and International College of Angiology 10/2020 | Meeting Participation | Online Associations & Affiliations # Member of the Austrian Medical Student Association AMSA Member of the Alumniclub SFU Medicine AC SFU Med
summary: My research interests focus on medical image analysis, vascular diseases, diabetes and disease prediction.
